text: What do you usually do when you encounter a piece of information you're unsure about?

answers: Depends on what the information is about and what impact it has on me if it is true/false

text: Have you every used a fact-checking tool and if so, which ones?
answers: I've used Snopes - but I don't like it. It stretches what is true or false. It's not objective at all. It gives the vibes of someone asking, "Is 2 + 2 = 4" and then Snopes will say, "Well... yes, but at the same time... - so we'll call this mostly True"
No, I usually google things to see if they are true or not

text: Would you prefer this tool as a mobile app, browser extension or something else?
answers: I probably wouldn't download a browser extension just for this purpose, but I wouldn't be opposed to it. I certainly don't want the extra clutter on a mobile app.
Mobile app and browser extension since I use both as ways to find my news.
Browser extension but a mobile app would be good too
A browser extension, since I probably wouldn't go to a separate website/app
